Graduates are equipped with sophisticated technical and communication skills, alongside capabilities in problem-solving and creative design, making them highly marketable.
What is the overarching goal of the School of Engineering's educational approach?
The overarching goal is to empower and enable graduates to become future leaders and responsible, enlightened citizens who can make a tangible difference in the world.
How does LIU ensure the quality of its engineering programs?
LIU ensures quality through continuous improvement, adopting best practices in curricula measurement and enhancement, and fostering excellence in teaching and research.
What does the school mean by 'serving the rapidly changing demands of a new century'?
It means the curriculum and teaching methods are regularly updated to keep pace with technological advancements and evolving industry needs, preparing students for future challenges.
How does the school balance breadth and depth in its undergraduate engineering degrees?
Undergraduate degrees are designed to provide both breadth in foundational engineering principles and depth in specific major areas, ensuring a comprehensive education.
What is the key benefit of Master Programs at LIU for engineering graduates?
Master Programs enhance the knowledge of graduates and equip them to deal with more technical topics and the complex challenges of future engineering practice.
What is the role of professors in guiding Master's graduates beyond academics?
Professors provide insight and wisdom drawn from practical experience, research, and their roles as teachers and parents, offering a holistic mentorship to Master's graduates.
How does the School of Engineering support students' professional networking?
Through cooperation with the school and connections with professors, Master's graduates are provided opportunities that can lead to valuable professional networking.
What is the purpose of the major and cumulative GPA requirement for graduation?
This requirement ensures that graduates have achieved a consistent level of academic proficiency across all their courses and specifically within their chosen field of study.
How are foreign baccalaureate degrees evaluated for equivalence at LIU?

parts.text_content: Foreign baccalaureate degrees are evaluated for equivalence to the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or Technical Baccalaureate degree (BT3) by relevant authorities, ensuring comparable academic standing.

parts.text: What is the benefit of providing a TOEFL or IELTS score if available for undergraduate applicants?
Providing these scores can exempt applicants from sitting for the LIU English Placement Test, streamlining the admission process for those who have already demonstrated English proficiency.
How does LIU accommodate Lebanese applicants regarding social security?
Lebanese applicants can either submit their national social security papers (daman) or pay a fee and fill out the necessary papers at the social security office, ensuring compliance.
What is the significance of the '$30 non-refundable application fees' for undergraduate and transfer students?
This fee covers the administrative costs associated with processing the application, including data entry, file creation, and initial review, regardless of the admission decision.
What is the purpose of the '$20 for each Entrance exam' fee for undergraduates and transfers?
This fee contributes to the costs of administering and grading the entrance exams, which are used to assess the readiness of applicants for their chosen programs.
How quickly does the School of Engineering process applications for LIU bachelor's degree holders applying to Master's programs?
Once the admission office sends the file to the School of Engineering, it will be studied and returned to the registrar with a decision within 72 hours.
What is the responsibility of the registrar officer for LIU bachelor's degree holders admitted to Master's programs?

The officer is responsible for changing the major, entering any remedial requirements, and opening a file that includes the curriculum along with the acceptance letter, which is then sent to the school immediately.
What is the key advantage for students transferring to LIU from another university?
They have the opportunity to obtain an American-style education, and their transcripts are reviewed to maximize transferable courses, potentially reducing their study duration.
What is included in the 'certified copy of the university transcript + course description' for transfer students?
This comprehensive document provides not only the student's academic record but also detailed information about the content of each course, crucial for evaluating transferability.
How does the Mechanical Engineering program prepare graduates for the job market?
It ensures graduates are fully prepared to create, plan, research, supervise, analyze, and act as professionals in mechanical technology to compete in today's job market.
What is the commitment to lifelong learning in the Mechanical Engineering program?
Graduates are expected to be committed to the engineering profession and to expanding their knowledge and skills with a high level of independence and responsibility.
What is the purpose of the B.S. in Telecommunication Engineering (TENG) program's focus on a continuously expanding industrial society?
It ensures that the curriculum and training provided are relevant and responsive to the evolving needs and technological advancements in the telecommunication industry.
How does the TENG program ensure graduates can operate in a global industry?
It emphasizes the development of communication skills and encourages continuous professional development, essential for working in an interconnected global industry.
What is the primary advantage of the B.S. in Computer Engineering (CENG) program providing a thorough understanding of both hardware and software?
This dual focus provides graduates with a versatile skill set, enabling them to work on a broader range of computing projects, from low-level systems to software applications.
What is the value of the Freshman Program for prospective LIU students?
The Freshman Program allows students to complete foundational credits before committing to a specific major, providing flexibility and ensuring they meet academic prerequisites.
Why are SAT I and SAT II exams required for freshman students to receive accreditation?
These standardized tests are required by the Ministry of Education for academic accreditation of freshman studies, ensuring a recognized level of preparedness for university education.
What is the consequence if a student already has a Lebanese baccalaureate and applies for the freshman program?
If a student has already completed the Lebanese baccalaureate or its equivalence, they cannot enroll in the freshman program, as they are expected to enter directly into a major.
How is a student's major determined after completing the freshman year?
Upon completion of the freshman year, students can enroll in a specific major at the sophomore level based on their academic average or GPA achieved during the freshman year.
What is the significance of the 'Freshman permission from the Lebanese Ministry of Higher Education' requirement?
This official permission confirms that the student is authorized by the Ministry to pursue freshman-level studies, particularly for those not holding a Lebanese baccalaureate.
Why are grades 10-11-and 12 required for freshman applicants?
These grades provide a comprehensive academic history of the applicant's secondary education, allowing LIU to assess their academic background and readiness for university studies.
What is the purpose of requiring SAT I and SAT II scores for freshman applicants?
These scores, along with the specified minimums, are used to assess academic aptitude and readiness for higher education, as mandated by the Ministry of Education for freshman accreditation.
What are the two methods for submitting an application to LIU?
Students can either submit an online application at www.liuserver.net or apply directly at the admission office with the assistance of an admission staff member.
What is the policy regarding the confidentiality and ownership of submitted application documents?
All applications and submitted official documents remain the sole property of LIU and will be kept confidential.
What is the primary function of the Dean of the School of Engineering?
The Dean oversees the school's mission to train and qualify future engineers, fosters research, promotes excellence, and ensures ethical education is integrated into all curricula.
How does the School of Engineering contribute to national development?
By producing highly skilled engineers who are capable of addressing contemporary and emerging issues, the school directly contributes to national development and technological advancement.
What kind of research output results from the school's collaborations?
Collaborations lead to extensive research output, indicating a strong commitment to advancing knowledge and innovation in various engineering fields.
How does the School of Engineering ensure its graduates are well-prepared for the job market upon graduation?
Graduates are equipped with sophisticated technical and communication skills, alongside capabilities in problem-solving and creative design, making them highly marketable.
What is the overarching goal of the School of Engineering's educational approach?
The overarching goal is to empower and enable graduates to become future leaders and responsible, enlightened citizens who can make a tangible difference in the world.
How does LIU ensure the quality of its engineering programs?
LIU ensures quality through continuous improvement, adopting best practices in curricula measurement and enhancement, and fostering excellence in teaching and research.
What does the school mean by 'serving the rapidly changing demands of a new century'?
It means the curriculum and teaching methods are regularly updated to keep pace with technological advancements and evolving industry needs, preparing students for future challenges.
How does the school balance breadth and depth in its undergraduate engineering degrees?
Undergraduate degrees are designed to provide both breadth in foundational engineering principles and depth in specific major areas, ensuring a comprehensive education.
What is the key benefit of Master Programs at LIU for engineering graduates?
Master Programs enhance the knowledge of graduates and equip them to deal with more technical topics and the complex challenges of future engineering practice.
What is the role of professors in guiding Master's graduates beyond academics?
Professors provide insight and wisdom drawn from practical experience, research, and their roles as teachers and parents, offering a holistic mentorship to Master's graduates.
How does the School of Engineering support students' professional networking?
Through cooperation with the school and connections with professors, Master's graduates are provided opportunities that can lead to valuable professional networking.
What is the purpose of the major and cumulative GPA requirement for graduation?
This requirement ensures that graduates have achieved a consistent level of academic proficiency across all their courses and specifically within their chosen field of study.
How are foreign baccalaureate degrees evaluated for equivalence at LIU?

parts.text_content: Foreign baccalaureate degrees are evaluated for equivalence to the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or Technical Baccalaureate degree (BT3) by relevant authorities, ensuring comparable academic standing.

parts.text: What is the benefit of providing a TOEFL or IELTS score if available for undergraduate applicants?
Providing these scores can exempt applicants from sitting for the LIU English Placement Test, streamlining the admission process for those who have already demonstrated English proficiency.
How does LIU accommodate Lebanese applicants regarding social security?
Lebanese applicants can either submit their national social security papers (daman) or pay a fee and fill out the necessary papers at the social security office, ensuring compliance.
What is the significance of the '$30 non-refundable application fees' for undergraduate and transfer students?
This fee covers the administrative costs associated with processing the application, including data entry, file creation, and initial review, regardless of the admission outcome.
What is the purpose of the '$20 for each Entrance exam' fee for undergraduates and transfers?
This fee contributes to the costs of administering and grading the entrance exams, which are used to assess the readiness of applicants for their chosen programs.
How quickly does the School of Engineering process applications for LIU bachelor's degree holders applying to Master's programs?
Once the admission office sends the file to the School of Engineering, it will be studied and returned to the registrar with a decision within 72 hours.
What is the responsibility of the registrar officer for LIU bachelor's degree holders admitted to Master's programs?

The officer is responsible for changing the major, entering any remedial requirements, and opening a file that includes the curriculum along with the acceptance letter, which is then sent to the school immediately.
What is the key advantage for students transferring to LIU from another university?
They have the opportunity to obtain an American-style education, and their transcripts are reviewed to maximize transferable courses, potentially reducing their study duration.
What is included in the 'certified copy of the university transcript + course description' for transfer students?
This comprehensive document provides not only the student's academic record but also detailed information about the content of each course, crucial for evaluating transferability.
What is the primary goal of the Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering (CIVE) program?
The CIVE program aims to graduate engineers capable of designing, constructing, and maintaining infrastructure projects crucial for society.
What are the key responsibilities of a Civil Engineer in the field?
Civil Engineers are responsible for the design, construction, supervision, and maintenance of public and private infrastructure, ensuring safety, functionality, and sustainability.
How does the CIVE program prepare students for professional licensure?
While not explicitly stated, the program's emphasis on core fundamentals, ethics, and professional responsibility aligns with the requirements for professional engineering licensure.
What is the role of laboratories in the CIVE curriculum?
Laboratories provide a strong hands-on experience, allowing students to apply theoretical knowledge, conduct experiments, and analyze data in a practical setting.
How does the CIVE program address contemporary challenges in civil engineering?
By covering diverse categories like environmental engineering and water resources, the program equips students to address modern challenges such as sustainable development and resource management.
What kind of projects would an Electronic Engineer (ELEC) typically work on?

Electronic Engineers work on designing, developing, testing, and maintaining electronic components, devices, and systems, including those in telecommunications, control systems, and consumer electronics.
How does the ELEC program ensure graduates are competent in a continuously expanding industrial society?

parts.text_content: The program provides high-quality training in conceptual knowledge and technical skills, constantly adapting to the evolving needs of the industrial sector.

parts.text: What is the relevance of digital signal processing in the ELEC curriculum?
Digital signal processing is crucial for understanding and manipulating digital signals, which is fundamental in modern communication systems, audio/video processing, and medical imaging.
What are the applications of microprocessors learned in the ELEC program?
Microprocessors are fundamental to embedded systems, control systems, and various electronic devices, so learning about their design and application is critical for an ELEC graduate.
What is the practical application of control systems in the ELEC field?
Control systems are used to automate processes and machines, from industrial automation to robotic systems, and are a key area of study for ELEC students.
What kind of technical equipment do Surveying Engineers (SURV) utilize?
Surveying Engineers utilize advanced equipment like Total Stations, GPS receivers, drones for photogrammetry, and specialized software for GIS applications.
What is the importance of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) in Surveying Engineering?
GIS is essential for managing, analyzing, and visualizing spatial data, crucial for urban planning, environmental management, and land development in surveying.
How does the SURV program contribute to infrastructure development?
Surveying engineers provide the precise measurements and spatial data necessary for the accurate planning, design, and construction of all types of infrastructure projects.
What are the responsibilities of an Electrical Engineer (EENG)?
Electrical engineers design, develop, test, and supervise the manufacturing of electrical equipment, from power generation and transmission to electronic devices and control systems.
What is the importance of power systems in the EENG curriculum?
Power systems are fundamental to electrical engineering, covering the generation, transmission, and distribution of electricity, which is vital for modern society.
What types of industries employ Industrial Engineers (IENG)?
Industrial engineers are employed in diverse industries such as manufacturing, logistics, healthcare, consulting, and service sectors, wherever processes need optimization.
How do Industrial Engineers contribute to efficiency and productivity?
Industrial engineers apply principles of engineering to optimize complex processes, systems, and organizations, aiming to improve efficiency, productivity, quality, and safety.
What is the significance of operations research in Industrial Engineering?
Operations research provides analytical tools and methodologies for decision-making and problem-solving, crucial for optimizing complex systems in industrial engineering.
How does the IENG program address quality control in industries?
The IENG curriculum includes topics on quality control, equipping graduates with techniques to monitor and improve the quality of products and processes, minimizing defects and waste.
What is the role of human factors in Industrial Engineering?
Human factors considers the interaction between humans and systems, optimizing work environments, tools, and processes to enhance human performance, safety, and well-being.
Why is Biomedical Engineering considered an emphasis within Electronic Engineering at LIU?
This emphasis suggests a strong foundation in electronic engineering principles applied to the design, development, and maintenance of medical equipment and healthcare systems.
What is the expected outcome of the Master's of Science in Electronic Engineering / Emphasis On Biomedical?
Graduates are expected to have advanced knowledge and skills in both electronic engineering and its biomedical applications, preparing them for specialized roles in the healthcare technology sector.
What makes the School of Engineering programs 'competitive'?
The programs are competitive due to their adoption of best practices in curricula measurement and enhancement, providing students with relevant skills and learning experiences sought by employers.
How does the School of Engineering promote a strong learning environment?
It ensures state-of-the-art laboratory facilities are functional, available, and accessible, alongside a supportive academic community.
What is the significance of the School of Engineering's international collaborations?
International collaborations, including co-supervision of doctoral students and organized conferences, expose students and faculty to global perspectives and research trends.
How does the School of Engineering support students in adapting to a global industry?
All programs emphasize developing communication skills necessary to operate in an increasingly global industry, along with fostering lifelong learning for continuous adaptation.
What is the role of student organizations or clubs within the School of Engineering?

While not explicitly detailed in the provided text, the emphasis on teamwork and community suggests that student organizations related to engineering could be supported to foster collaboration and leadership skills.
What is the mission of the Department of Civil Engineering (CIVE) at LIU?

The mission of the Department of Civil Engineering (CIVE) at LIU is to provide high-quality engineering education that prepares students for successful careers in civil engineering and for lifelong learning.
What analytical abilities are emphasized in the SURV program?
SURV graduates acquire skills for analysis and problem-solving, with a strong focus on developing solutions to problems encountered in a professional setting.
How does the SURV program prepare students for professional development and communication?
SURV graduates will be able to continue their professional development and gain the communication skills required to operate in an increasingly global industry.
What specific topics are covered in SURV courses?
SURV courses deal with topics such as land surveying, geodesy, photogrammetry, remote sensing, geographic information systems (GIS), and global positioning systems (GPS).
What is the typical duration of the undergraduate Surveying Engineering program?
It is a three-year program.
What is the primary objective of the Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering (EENG) program?
The primary objective of the EENG program is to produce competent engineers highly trained in Electrical Engineering to meet the needs of a continuously expanding industrial society.
What conceptual knowledge and technical skills do EENG graduates acquire?
EENG graduates gain conceptual knowledge and technical skills, demonstrating understanding of fundamental concepts and acquiring technical skills for electrical engineering tasks.
What analytical and problem-solving skills are emphasized in the EENG program?
EENG graduates acquire skills for analysis and problem-solving, with a strong focus on developing solutions to problems similar to those encountered in a professional setting.
How does the EENG program prepare students for continuous professional development and global communication?
EENG graduates will be able to continue their professional development and gain the communication skills required to operate in an increasingly global industry.
What topics are typically covered in EENG courses?
EENG courses deal with topics such as power systems, control systems, electrical machines, circuits, electronics, and instrumentation.
What is the duration of the undergraduate Electrical Engineering program?
It is a three-year program.
What is the primary objective of the Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering (IENG) program?
The primary objective of the IENG program is to produce competent engineers highly trained in Industrial Engineering to meet the needs of a continuously expanding industrial society.
What kind of knowledge and technical skills do IENG graduates gain?
IENG graduates gain conceptual knowledge and technical skills, demonstrating understanding of fundamental concepts and acquiring technical skills for industrial engineering tasks.
What analytical abilities are emphasized in the IENG program?
IENG graduates acquire skills for analysis and problem-solving, with a strong focus on developing solutions to problems encountered in a professional setting.
How does the IENG program prepare students for professional development and communication in a global context?
IENG graduates will be able to continue their professional development and gain the communication skills required to operate in an increasingly global industry.
What topics are covered in IENG courses?
IENG courses deal with topics such as operations research, supply chain management, quality control, manufacturing systems, human factors, and production planning.
What is the typical duration of the undergraduate Industrial Engineering program?
It is a three-year program.
Does LIU's School of Engineering have an emphasis on Biomedical Engineering?

Yes, LIU's School of Engineering offers an Electronic Engineering / Emphasis On Biomedical major at the undergraduate level, and a Master's of Science in Electronic Engineering / Emphasis On Biomedical.
What is the role of continuous improvement within the School of Engineering?

The School of Engineering is committed to continuous improvement in its curricula and programs, adopting best practices in measuring, maintaining, and enhancing its offerings to ensure students receive a competitive learning and skill development experience.
How does the School of Engineering foster a sense of community among students?

The school provides an attractive, serviceable laboratory environment that promotes a sense of community among students, ensuring state-of-the-art laboratory facilities are functional, available, and accessible.
What kind of real-world experiences are provided to engineering students?
The school has forged memorandums of understanding for academic and industrial activities, which include structured internships for students, providing practical work experience.
Does the School of Engineering prepare students for advanced degrees and research?
Yes, LIU engineering graduates often go on to professional and graduate schools, and the school fosters research, preparing graduate students to pursue higher education in various engineering fields.
What is the importance of faculty insights for Master's graduates?

Master's graduates are encouraged to keep in touch with professors who bring insight and wisdom from many different perspectives â€“ practical experience, research, and the roles of teachers and parents.
What is the role of the registrar officer in the graduate admission process for non-LIU students?

The registrar officer is fully responsible for changing the major, entering any remedial requirements, and opening a file that includes the curriculum along with the acceptance letter, which is then sent to the school immediately.
What is the general philosophy behind LIU's engineering curriculum structure?

LIU's academic work is formulated in modules of subject matter referred to as courses, each with scheduled instructional time, laboratory, field exercise, and homework, designed to provide comprehensive learning.
What flexibility exists in choosing technical electives within the School of Engineering?

While technical electives are mostly selected from courses within related programs in a school, some may be selected from programs within different schools if they closely relate to the major requirements and serve program objectives and student learning.
What is the purpose of specific emphasis/concentration courses in some engineering programs?
Some programs may specify specific courses within a specified emphasis/concentration to give students the opportunity to gain in-depth knowledge in an area of their choice.
How does the School of Engineering ensure its graduates are well-rounded professionals?
In addition to technical and professional development, the School of Engineering integrates ethical education in all curricula to foster well-rounded and responsible professionals.
What is the objective for students regarding communication skills in engineering programs?
A key objective for students in all engineering programs is to be able to communicate effectively in oral, written, and electronic media, essential for professional success.
What is the general expectation for graduates regarding lifelong learning in engineering?

Graduates are expected to be committed to the engineering profession and to expanding their knowledge and skills with a high level of independence and responsibility, reflecting a commitment to lifelong learning.
How does the School of Engineering adapt to rapidly changing demands?
The School of Engineering prepares students to serve the rapidly changing demands of a new century through its undergraduate degrees, which provide both breadth and depth in engineering knowledge.
What kind of problems are LIU engineering graduates capable of solving?
LIU engineering graduates are well known for their capability to work through difficult problems, solve problems effectively, and design creatively.
How does LIU's School of Engineering support its alumni?

It is hoped that through cooperation with the school, our master graduates are provided opportunities for practical work experience, international study and community, fostering ongoing connections and support.
What is the significance of the 70% GPA requirement for graduation?

The 70% GPA requirement, equivalent to a 2.0 GPA, signifies the minimum academic standard required for both undergraduate and graduate students to demonstrate proficiency in their major and overall studies for graduation.
Why is the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree or its equivalence required for undergraduate applications?

This requirement ensures that applicants possess a foundational secondary education recognized by Lebanese educational standards or an internationally acknowledged equivalent, crucial for university-level studies.
What is the purpose of the LIU English Placement Test for undergraduate applicants?
The LIU English Placement Test, or accepted TOEFL/IELTS scores, assesses the applicant's English language proficiency, which is essential for success in an English-medium academic environment.
Why are identification and family civil status records required for applications?
These documents are required for official identification, verification of personal details, and for administrative record-keeping as per university and national regulations.
What is the purpose of the national social security papers (daman) requirement for Lebanese applicants?
This requirement ensures that Lebanese applicants comply with national social security regulations, which may cover health insurance or other benefits during their studies.
Why are application and entrance exam fees non-refundable?
The non-refundable nature of these fees covers the administrative costs associated with processing applications and organizing entrance exams, regardless of the admission outcome.
How does the School of Engineering ensure its graduates are prepared for diverse industries?

The School of Engineering lays out a foundation that equips students with sophisticated technical and communications skills, making them exceptional to the marketplace and prepared for a wide variety of industries globally.
What role does practical experience play in the School of Engineering's curriculum?

Practical experience is integrated through cooperation with the school, providing opportunities for practical work experience and strong hands-on experience by means of lab courses, summer internships, and final year projects.
How does the School of Engineering encourage innovation and creativity?
The school promotes an environment where graduates are recognized for their ability to solve problems and design creatively, fostering innovation within its programs.
What makes LIU engineering graduates exceptional in the marketplace?

parts.text_content: Their sophisticated technical and communications skills, problem-solving capabilities, creative design abilities, and flexibility are cited as qualities that make them exceptional in the marketplace.

parts.text: How does the School of Engineering at LIU maintain strong academic programs?

parts.text_content: It sustains quality academic programs through the recruitment and retention of qualified faculty, in addition to fostering research.

The School of Engineering aims to create a collaborative and inclusive environment that promotes a sense of community among students.

Professors bring insight and wisdom from many different perspectives â€“ practical experience, research, and the roles of teachers and parents â€“ contributing to a rich learning environment.

The school has forged memorandums of understanding with national, regional, and international institutions to actively collaborate in academic and industrial activities.
What is the ultimate goal of the SoEN vision?
The ultimate goal is to be recognized as one of the nationâ€™s leading engineering schools by empowering and enabling graduates to make a difference on contemporary and emerging issues.
How does the School of Engineering prepare students for leadership roles?
Its mission includes providing students with the required skills and abilities to succeed as engineers and to become future leaders in their professions.
What role do ethics play in the engineering curriculum at LIU?
The School of Engineering integrates ethical education in all curricula, fostering a real sense of ethics in its students.
What does 'lifelong learning capacities' mean in the context of LIU's engineering education?
It means encouraging students to continuously expand their knowledge and skills with a high level of independence and responsibility throughout their careers.
What is the significance of the 5-year duration for the undergraduate Engineering program?
The 5-year duration indicates a comprehensive program designed to provide extensive breadth and depth in engineering education, preparing students thoroughly for their careers.
What is the purpose of the 'Contract Sheet' and 'Plan of Study' for undergraduate majors?
These documents provide detailed information about the course sequence, requirements, and academic plan for each specific major, guiding students through their studies.
What is the significance of the 'Course Description' documents for majors?
Course descriptions provide detailed outlines of each course, including learning objectives, topics covered, and prerequisites, helping students understand the content of their chosen major.
Why is a certified copy of the university transcript required for graduate applications?
The certified transcript provides an official record of the applicant's academic performance, courses taken, and grades achieved, essential for assessing their eligibility for graduate studies.
What is the purpose of an official transcript being mailed by the institution for non-LIU graduate applicants?
This ensures the authenticity and integrity of the academic record, directly from the awarding institution, minimizing the risk of fraud.
Why is a certified degree, approved by the Ministry of Higher Education, required for non-LIU graduate applicants?
This validates the legitimacy of the degree and ensures it is recognized by the national educational authority, a crucial step for acceptance into graduate programs.
What is the role of the English Examination result in non-LIU graduate admissions?
The English Examination result assesses the applicant's proficiency in English, which is vital for academic success in a program that likely uses English as the primary language of instruction.
What is the typical timeframe for the School of Engineering to review a graduate application file?
The file will be studied and returned to the registrar with either an acceptance or rejection letter within 72 hours.
How does LIU ensure a smooth transition for transfer students?
LIU reviews all transfer student transcripts to determine which courses may be transferable towards their program of study, facilitating a smooth academic transition.

It implies an education system that often emphasizes critical thinking, practical application, and a broad-based curriculum, preparing students for diverse global professional environments.

Industrial engineers are employed in diverse industries such as manufacturing, logistics, healthcare, consulting, and service sectors, wherever processes need optimization.
How do Industrial Engineers contribute to efficiency and productivity?
Industrial engineers apply principles of engineering to optimize complex processes, systems, and organizations, aiming to improve efficiency, productivity, quality, and safety.
What is the significance of operations research in Industrial Engineering?
Operations research provides analytical tools and methodologies for decision-making and problem-solving, crucial for optimizing complex systems in industrial engineering.
How does the IENG program address quality control in industries?
The IENG curriculum includes topics on quality control, equipping graduates with techniques to monitor and improve the quality of products and processes, minimizing defects and waste.
What is the role of human factors in Industrial Engineering?
Human factors considers the interaction between humans and systems, optimizing work environments, tools, and processes to enhance human performance, safety, and well-being.
Why is Biomedical Engineering considered an emphasis within Electronic Engineering at LIU?
This emphasis suggests a strong foundation in electronic engineering principles applied to the design, development, and maintenance of medical equipment and healthcare systems.
What is the expected outcome of the Master's of Science in Electronic Engineering / Emphasis On Biomedical?
Graduates are expected to have advanced knowledge and skills in both electronic engineering and its biomedical applications, preparing them for specialized roles in the healthcare technology sector.
What makes the School of Engineering programs 'competitive'?
The programs are competitive due to their adoption of best practices in curricula measurement and enhancement, providing students with relevant skills and learning experiences sought by employers.
How does the School of Engineering promote a strong learning environment?
It ensures state-of-the-art laboratory facilities are functional, available, and accessible, alongside a supportive academic community.
What is the significance of the School of Engineering's international collaborations?
International collaborations, including co-supervision of doctoral students and organized conferences, expose students and faculty to global perspectives and research trends.
How does the School of Engineering support students in adapting to a global industry?
All programs emphasize developing communication skills necessary to operate in an increasingly global industry, along with fostering lifelong learning for continuous adaptation.
What is the role of student organizations or clubs within the School of Engineering?

While not explicitly detailed in the provided text, the emphasis on teamwork and community suggests that student organizations related to engineering could be supported to foster collaboration and leadership skills.
What is the primary function of the Dean of the School of Engineering?
The Dean oversees the school's mission to train and qualify future engineers, fosters research, promotes excellence, and ensures ethical education is integrated into all curricula.
How does the School of Engineering contribute to national development?
By producing highly skilled engineers who are capable of addressing contemporary and emerging issues, the school directly contributes to national development and technological advancement.
What kind of research output results from the school's collaborations?
Collaborations lead to extensive research output, indicating a strong commitment to advancing knowledge and innovation in various engineering fields.
How does the School of Engineering ensure its graduates are well-prepared for the job market upon graduation?
Graduates are equipped with sophisticated technical and communication skills, alongside capabilities in problem-solving and creative design, making them highly marketable.
What is the overarching goal of the School of Engineering's educational approach?
The overarching goal is to empower and enable graduates to become future leaders and responsible, enlightened citizens who can make a tangible difference in the world.
How does LIU ensure the quality of its engineering programs?
LIU ensures quality through continuous improvement, adopting best practices in curricula measurement and enhancement, and fostering excellence in teaching and research.
What does the school mean by 'serving the rapidly changing demands of a new century'?
It means the curriculum and teaching methods are regularly updated to keep pace with technological advancements and evolving industry needs, preparing students for future challenges.
How does the school balance breadth and depth in its undergraduate engineering degrees?
Undergraduate degrees are designed to provide both breadth in foundational engineering principles and depth in specific major areas, ensuring a comprehensive education.
What is the key benefit of Master Programs at LIU for engineering graduates?
Master Programs enhance the knowledge of graduates and equip them to deal with more technical topics and the complex challenges of future engineering practice.
What is the role of professors in guiding Master's graduates beyond academics?
Professors provide insight and wisdom drawn from practical experience, research, and their roles as teachers and parents, offering a holistic mentorship to Master's graduates.
How does the School of Engineering support students' professional networking?
Through cooperation with the school and connections with professors, Master's graduates are provided opportunities that can lead to valuable professional networking.
What is the purpose of the major and cumulative GPA requirement for graduation?
This requirement ensures that graduates have achieved a consistent level of academic proficiency across all their courses and specifically within their chosen field of study.
How are foreign baccalaureate degrees evaluated for equivalence at LIU?

parts.text_content: Foreign baccalaureate degrees are evaluated for equivalence to the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or Technical Baccalaureate degree (BT3) by relevant authorities, ensuring comparable academic standing.

parts.text: What is the benefit of providing a TOEFL or IELTS score if available for undergraduate applicants?
Providing these scores can exempt applicants from sitting for the LIU English Placement Test, streamlining the admission process for those who have already demonstrated English proficiency.
How does LIU accommodate Lebanese applicants regarding social security?
Lebanese applicants can either submit their national social security papers (daman) or pay a fee and fill out the necessary papers at the social security office, ensuring compliance.
What is the significance of the '$30 non-refundable application fees' for undergraduate and transfer students?
This fee covers the administrative costs associated with processing the application, including data entry, file creation, and initial review, regardless of the admission outcome.
What is the purpose of the '$20 for each Entrance exam' fee for undergraduates and transfers?
This fee contributes to the costs of administering and grading the entrance exams, which are used to assess the readiness of applicants for their chosen programs.
How quickly does the School of Engineering process applications for LIU bachelor's degree holders applying to Master's programs?
Once the admission office sends the file to the School of Engineering, it will be studied and returned to the registrar with a decision within 72 hours.
What is the responsibility of the registrar officer for LIU bachelor's degree holders admitted to Master's programs?

The officer is responsible for changing the major, entering any remedial requirements, and opening a file that includes the curriculum along with the acceptance letter, which is then sent to the school immediately.
What is the key advantage for students transferring to LIU from another university?
They have the opportunity to obtain an American-style education, and their transcripts are reviewed to maximize transferable courses, potentially reducing their study duration.
What is included in the 'certified copy of the university transcript + course description' for transfer students?
This comprehensive document provides not only the student's academic record but also detailed information about the content of each course, crucial for evaluating transferability.
What is the primary goal of the Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering (MENG) program?
The MENG program aims to graduate engineers fully prepared to create, plan, research, supervise, analyze, and act as professionals in mechanical technology to compete in today's job market.
What is the commitment to lifelong learning in the Mechanical Engineering program?
Graduates are expected to be committed to the engineering profession and to expanding their knowledge and skills with a high level of independence and responsibility.
What kind of topics are covered in Mechanical Engineering (MENG) courses?

MENG courses deal with topics such as statics and dynamics, mechanical vibrations, mechanical systems, thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, heat transfer, electric machines, materials science, and mechanics of materials.
What are the common career paths for Mechanical Engineering graduates?

MENG graduates can find careers in diverse industries including heating, ventilating, and air conditioning (HVAC), transportation, power generation and distribution, metal production and processing, manufacturing, and the design of machines and structures.
What is the primary objective of the Bachelor of Science in Telecommunication Engineering (TENG) program?
The TENG program aims to produce competent engineers highly trained in Telecommunication Engineering to meet the needs of a continuously expanding industrial society.
How does the TENG program ensure graduates can operate in a global industry?
It emphasizes the development of communication skills and encourages continuous professional development, essential for working in an interconnected global industry.
What specific topics are covered in Telecommunication Engineering (TENG) courses?

TENG courses cover topics such as electrical circuits and systems, electronics, telecommunications, digital system design, microprocessor design, radio frequency electronics, networks, electromagnetism, transmission lines, and antennas.
What is the primary advantage of the Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering (CENG) program providing a thorough understanding of both hardware and software?
This dual focus provides graduates with a versatile skill set, enabling them to work on a broader range of computing projects, from low-level systems to software applications.
What are the key areas of study in Computer Engineering (CENG)?
Key areas of study in CENG include data structures and algorithms, programming languages, networks and database systems, microcomputers, and operating systems.
What is the value of the Freshman Program for prospective LIU students?
The Freshman Program allows students to complete foundational credits before committing to a specific major, providing flexibility and ensuring they meet academic prerequisites.
Why are SAT I and SAT II exams required for freshman students to receive accreditation?
These standardized tests are required by the Ministry of Education for academic accreditation of freshman studies, ensuring a recognized level of preparedness for university education.
What is the consequence if a student already has a Lebanese baccalaureate and applies for the freshman program?
If a student has already completed the Lebanese baccalaureate or its equivalence, they cannot enroll in the freshman program, as they are expected to enter directly into a major.
How is a student's major determined after completing the freshman year?
Upon completion of the freshman year, students can enroll in a specific major at the sophomore level based on their academic average or GPA achieved during the freshman year.
What is the significance of the 'Freshman permission from the Lebanese Ministry of Higher Education' requirement?
This official permission confirms that the student is authorized by the Ministry to pursue freshman-level studies, particularly for those not holding a Lebanese baccalaureate.
Why are grades 10-11-and 12 required for freshman applicants?
These grades provide a comprehensive academic history of the applicant's secondary education, allowing LIU to assess their academic background and readiness for university studies.
What is the purpose of requiring SAT I and SAT II scores for freshman applicants?
These scores, along with the specified minimums, are used to assess academic aptitude and readiness for higher education, as mandated by the Ministry of Education for freshman accreditation.
What are the two methods for submitting an application to LIU?
Students can either submit an online application at www.liuserver.net or apply directly at the admission office with the assistance of an admission staff member.
What is the policy regarding the confidentiality and ownership of submitted application documents?
All applications and submitted official documents remain the sole property of LIU and will be kept confidential.
What is the typical duration of the undergraduate Mechanical Engineering program?
It is a three-year program.
What is the typical duration of the undergraduate Telecommunication Engineering program?
It is a three-year program.
What is the typical duration of the undergraduate Computer Engineering program?
It is a three-year program.
What are the general requirements for undergraduate admission to LIU?

General requirements for undergraduate admission include a Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or its equivalence, successful completion of the LIU English Placement Test (or accepted TOEFL/IELTS scores), identification and family civil status records, national social security papers for Lebanese applicants, and non-refundable application and entrance exam fees.
What specific SAT score minimums are required for Freshman Science applicants?
Freshman Science applicants need a minimum of 1000 for SAT I and 1450 for SAT II (combining SAT I & II total of 2300/1600 if only SAT I).
What is the role of the Admission Office in the application process?
The Admission Office assists applicants with the process, receives documents, and forwards files to the relevant schools for review.
How does LIU ensure academic integrity during the admissions process?
LIU ensures academic integrity by requiring certified transcripts and degrees, and by having official transcripts mailed directly from previous institutions for non-LIU applicants.
What opportunities are available for engineering students to engage in research?

The school fosters research activities, and international collaborations (including co-supervision of doctoral students) provide extensive research output and opportunities for students to participate.
How does the School of Engineering adapt its programs to meet employer needs?

The school is committed to continuous improvement, adopting best practices in curricula measurement and enhancement, and equipping students with sophisticated technical and communication skills that are highly marketable.
What is the purpose of the 72-hour review period for Master's applications?
This timeframe ensures a prompt and efficient review of graduate applications by the School of Engineering, allowing for timely admission decisions.
How does LIU support transfer students in course selection?
LIU reviews all transfer student transcripts and course descriptions to determine transferable credits, helping students select appropriate courses to complete their degree efficiently.
What kind of laboratory facilities are available for Mechanical Engineering students?
The program emphasizes practical skills through laboratory sessions, with facilities continuously updated to incorporate the latest technology relevant to mechanical engineering.
How does the Telecommunication Engineering program prepare students for an information processing environment?

The curriculum provides thorough knowledge in areas such as networks, digital system design, and microprocessors, preparing students for the demands of a rapidly evolving information processing environment.
What are the common applications of Computer Engineering in today's world?
Computer Engineering has applications in embedded systems, software development, network design, operating systems, and artificial intelligence, all of which are covered in the LIU CENG program.
What is the benefit of the Freshman Program for students who are undecided about their major?
The Freshman Program offers a period for students to explore different fields and fulfill foundational requirements before making a definitive choice on their major, providing flexibility.
What documents are required to apply for the Freshman Program?
Applicants need Freshman permission from the Lebanese Ministry of Higher Education, certified copies of grades 10, 11, and 12, and official SAT I and SAT II scores that meet the minimum requirements.
What is the importance of having accurate and complete application documents?
Accurate and complete documents are crucial for a smooth application process, enabling LIU to properly assess eligibility and academic readiness, as all submitted documents become LIU's property.

What is the attendance policy?

At LIU, students may miss no more than 33.33% of any course during a regular semester or summer term. Attendance is taken for all class sessions from the first to the last day of classes, and excuses of any nature do NOT eliminate an absence. Students who exceed this limit are automatically given an AW (Academic Withdrawal) grade and will not be allowed to attend class any longer.

How can I apply to LIU?

To apply to LIU as an undergraduate student, you need to prepare these documents:
1. Certified copy of Lebanese Baccalaureate (BACCII) or equivalent
2. TOEFL/IELTS score or take LIU's English Placement Test
3. Copy of ID card
4. Copy of family civil status record
5. Recent passport-sized photo
6. National social security papers (if Lebanese)
7. $30 non-refundable application fee
8. $20 for each entrance exam

You can apply online through the 'Apply Now' link on the LIU website or contact admissions@liu.edu.lb for assistance.

Tell me about the School of Engineering

The School of Engineering at LIU prepares students for professional careers with sophisticated technical and communication skills. The school offers various undergraduate programs including Electronic Engineering with emphasis on Biomedical, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Surveying Engineering, Communication Engineering, and Industrial Engineering. Each program requires 108 credits for graduation.

At the graduate level, the school offers Master's degrees in these same fields, requiring 52 credits. The school's mission is to train and qualify future engineers for successful careers while fostering research and maintaining an active faculty that promotes excellence. For more information, you can contact soe@liu.edu.lb.

What is the grading system at LIU?

LIU uses a quality points (QPTS) grading system:
- 90% or higher = 4.0 QPTS
- 80% = 3.0 QPTS
- 70% = 2.0 QPTS
- 60% = 1.0 QPTS
- Below 60% = 0 QPTS

Undergraduate rating scale:
- 3.91-4.00: Excellent
- 3.28-3.90: Very Good
- 2.64-3.27: Good
- 2.0-2.63: Satisfactory
- Below 2.0: Unsatisfactory

Course status abbreviations include AW (Academic Withdrawal), I (Incomplete), W (Withdrawal), and P/NP (Pass/Not-Pass for remedial courses).

What is the make-up examination policy?

Students are eligible for make-up exams under specific conditions:
1. Sickness (proven by hospitalization report/discharge summary)
2. Death in the family (proven by death certificate and personal identification)
3. Accidents (proven by expert report)

The deadline to submit petitions is the first Monday after the last examination. For mid-term exams, students must appeal directly to their school with approval from the Dean/Associate Dean required. Make-up final exams are scheduled before the start of the next semester, with specific dates for Fall, Spring, and Summer terms.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
How do I change my major?

To change your major at LIU:

1. Within the same School: You must meet the requirements for admission to the new major and submit a change of major form from the Registrar's Office. The request is considered by the Department and Dean concerned. After approval, the form is sent to the Registrar's Office for implementation.

2. Moving to another School: You are considered a new student by the new School and must meet its admission requirements. Fill out a change of major form from the Registrar's Office, which will be reviewed by the Department and Dean. After approval, it's sent to the Registrar's Office for implementation.

Tell me about the School of Pharmacy

The School of Pharmacy at LIU offers a Bachelor's degree in Pharmacy requiring 179 credits, typically completed in 3 years. The school also offers a Doctor of Pharmacy (Pharm D) postgraduate degree requiring 30 credits.

The School of Pharmacy's vision is to be a socially accountable institution committed to advancing the pharmacy profession through education, practice, research, and community outreach. Its mission is to develop distinguished professionals in pharmacy practice, research, and community services through a dynamic educational program aligned with national and international standards.

Admissions to the pharmacy program occur once a year, and applicants may apply from May until mid-August for the Pharmacy Entrance Exam. For more information, you can contact sop@liu.edu.lb.
You are an educational chatbot for LIU.
What is the history of LIU?

The Lebanese International University (LIU) was first founded as Bekaa University under Presidential Decree No. 5294 in April 2001, with its first two campuses in Al-Khyara (western Bekaa valley) and Beirut. The name was later changed to Lebanese International University as the founders envisioned making it a national university with presence in all six administrative districts of Lebanon.

Between 2003 and 2013, LIU established seven additional campuses in Lebanon: Saida, Nabatieh, Tripoli, Mount Lebanon, Tyre, Rayak, and Halba-Akkar. Since 2006, LIU expanded internationally, establishing four campuses in Yemen (Sanaa, Aden, and Taiz), one in Mauritania, and one in Senegal.

The university has been under the leadership of Mr. Abdul Rahim Mourad, founder and President, since 2001. LIU's mission focuses on providing access to higher education for first-generation students and democratizing higher education.

What are the application requirements for an undergraduate pharmacy program at LIU?

To apply to LIU as a bachelor student for the pharmacy program, you need to prepare the following documents:
- Certified copy of the Lebanese Baccalaureate Degree (BACCII) or Technical Baccalaureate degree (BT3) or their equivalence (Foreign Baccalaureate).
- TOEFL (International IBT) or IELTS score, if available, or must sit for the LIU English Placement Test.
- 1 copy of the identification card.
- 1 copy of family civil status record.
- 1 recent passport sized colored photograph.
- All Lebanese applicants must submit their national social security papers (daman), if available, or must pay $135 and fill the appropriate papers at the social security office.
- $30 non-refundable application fees.
- $20 for each Entrance exam.

What is the vision and mission of the School of Business?

The SoBU Vision is to play an effective role in developing a generation of future business leaders capable of significantly influencing policy, practice, and people. The SoBU Mission is to provide Lebanese and International students with an affirmative and career-focused education, upholding analytical and critical thinking, ethical apprehension, and cultural conscientiousness in expected global business leaders. The school is also committed to delivering high-quality teaching, research, and learning opportunities that combine academic excellence with impact upon business and society, through curricula aligned with the latest trends in Business industries.

What are the graduation requirements for Bachelor of Business Administration programs?

In the Bachelor of Business Administration programs, students must successfully complete a minimum of 99 credit hours, which include: 1-A minimum of 24 credit hours of General Education Required courses. 2-A minimum of 42 credit hours of Core Business Required courses (Minimum 40% of total credit hours requirements) with a minimum GPA of 2.0. 3-A minimum of 33 credit hours of Major Required courses (minimum 25% of total credit hours requirements) with a minimum of 2.00 in both the Major GPA and the Cumulative GPA.

What are the graduation requirements for Master's Degree of Business Administration programs?

In the Master's Degree of Business Administration programs, students holding a Bachelor degree in Business Administration related majors must successfully complete 39 credit hours (500 or above Business courses) as indicated below: 1-A minimum of 21 credit hours of Core Required courses. 2-A minimum of 12 credit hours of Major Required courses. 3-A minimum of 6 credit hours of Major Elective courses. For more details, or for any other inquiries, you can email sob@liu.edu.lb.

TOEFL (International IBT) or IELTS score, if available, or you must sit for the LIU English Placement Test. 1 copy of the identification card. 1 copy of family civil status record. 1 recent passport sized colored photograph. What are the admission requirements for the freshman program?

To complete the freshman program, each student must complete at least 30 credits in Freshman Arts, Freshman Sciences, or Freshman Engineering. Students must also complete the SAT I and SAT II to receive accreditation by the Ministry of Education. The Admissions Office combines SAT I and SAT II quality points for evaluation. The minimum required scores for Freshman Arts are SAT I and SAT II combined score of 2600, and for Freshman Sciences/Engineering are 2750. Additionally, a certified copy of the Freshman permission from the Lebanese Ministry of Higher Education, certified copies of grades 10-11-and 12, copies of identification and family civil status records, a recent passport-sized colored photograph, and a non-refundable application fee of $30 and an English entrance exam fee of $20 are required.

How can I apply for financial aid at LIU?

Students may apply for financial aid by filling out an application form obtained from the Studentsâ€™ Affairs Office (SAO). Upon obtaining the application, students should schedule an interview with a Financial Aid Officer (FAO) at the SAO and submit the complete form with appropriate documents before the official deadline. Dates and deadlines are updated on the LIU website and academic year calendar. The application deadline is the end of the 5th week of an academic semester. Financial Aid applications must be renewed every academic year by filling a 'Renewal Form' from the SAO. The Financial Aid Committee reviews each application carefully and makes the appropriate decision.
